intro: Tithymalus hypoleucus, commonly known as the white thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant features a robust stem with rough, hairy surfaces and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in a single head with ray florets. Tithymalus hypoleucus is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
